IO functions¶

The myio module provides some common IO operations functions on hms, hss, actdist files.

lammps_hic.myio.pack_hms(prefix, n_struct, hss=None, violations=None, info=None, remove_after=False)[source]¶

TODO: write docs

lammps_hic.myio.read_actdist(filename)[source]¶

Alias for read_full_actdist

lammps_hic.myio.read_full_actdist(filename)[source]¶

Reads activation distances.

Activation distances are a list/array of records. Every record consists of:

  • i (int): first bead index
  • j (int): second bead index
  • pwish (float): the desired contact probability
  • actdist (float): the activation distance
  • pclean (float): the corrected probability from the iterative correction
  • pnow (float): the current contact probability
lammps_hic.myio.read_hms(fname)[source]¶

TODO: write docs

lammps_hic.myio.read_hss(fname, i=None)[source]¶

Reads all information in an hss file

Returns:population coordinates radii (numpy.ndarray(dtype=’f4’)): bead radii chrom (numpy.ndarray(dtype=str)): chromosome tags n_struct (int): number of structures n_bead (int): number of beads in one structure
Return type:crd (numpy.ndarray(dtype=’f4’))
lammps_hic.myio.remove_hms(prefix, n_struct)[source]¶

Removes hms files.
